This is my fault - I should have mentioned the following during orientation. We only allow members to host events on the 2nd floor of Coworking** if your event has 50 members or more registered.** This is a lesson we learned last year - members trying to do their work found it very distracting if small groups were using the mics/screens.

If your event crosses the 50-person threshold, I will teach you how to use the screen. 

Until then, I recommend using the ping pong room or one of the other rooms on 13 for an indoor event. We are working on getting more event spaces open for you.

The SGAC must be submitted within 3 days prior to arrival, including the day of arrival‚Äîso last-minute is fine, not strictly 3 days before. It‚Äôs also completely free through the official ICA channels, no fees required.

I arrived via Changi airport yesterday. The whole process for immigration was automated and smooth. You just need to scan the passport. I am a US citizen, and had to fill in the Singapore arrival card 3 days before travel. I missed this part and filled in a day prior to travel. The approval was instant but had to pay USD 93. Don‚Äôt forget to fill in the arrival card 3 days before your trip.

The Malaysian MMH2 program is interesting. Here in the Philippines, we have the SRRV program (Special Retiree Resident Visa) and SIRV program (Special Investor Resident Visa), which are similar but less expensive (no property requirement, although money remitted into the program could be used for future condo purchases). The SRRV and SIRV programs allow participants to be eligible to work for a local company (although a separate work permit application is required, the work permit will not need to be tied to a work-visa, which is usually harder to get). The Malaysian MMH2 program also allows one to work for a local company with additional work permit, with added benefit that those over 50 do not need to get work permit.

Updated Information for SCSM2024 Ekiden and Marathon Runners:

 ** - Ekiden Teams: One representative from each team must collect the race pack.**
**  - Individual Runners: Each runner may pick up their own race pack plus up to two additional packs.**

- Race Pack Collection:
  - Dates and Location:
    - November 28, 29: 9:00 AM ‚Äì 8:00 PM
    - November 30: 9:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM
    - Location: Sands Expo and Convention Centre, Basement 2, Hall F

- What‚Äôs Included in Each Race Pack:
    - Race bib with timing chip
    - Ekiden sash with timing tag (for relay handover)
    - Official PUMA running singlet
    - Foldable backpack

- Ekiden Changeover Zones:
  - Zone 1: Raffles Blvd (outside F1 Pit Building)
  - Zone 2: ECP Carpark D5
  - Zone 3: Marina Barrage
  - Zone 4: Tanjong Pagar Railway Station
  - Shuttle Services: Shuttles are available to transport runners to Changeover Zones 2, 3, and 4, as well as back to the Finish Venue post-race.

- SCSM+ App:
  - Track live locations of runners, view all aid station locations, and follow pacers holding balloons indicating their pace.

Technically, you can. I remember a friend telling me he knows an Aussie guy who‚Äôs done that for the past decade with no issues. However, it depends on the immigration officer you get and how long you want to stay each year. With this approach, it‚Äôs better to keep your time under 6 months per year IMO. 

Another option would be the MM2H visa, though they recently increased the price, or you could incorporate a company here.
Obviously there is a limit, so perhaps worth setting a cutoff when you‚Äôre certain you want to make it a long term thing

It‚Äôs not a guarantee and it‚Äôs your decision so DYOR etc. But in practicality, you‚Äôre most likely safe to do this a few times. I have previously stayed in Malaysia for long periods of time like this with no problems - I.e. no DN visa, just leaving and coming back to get a new 90 day visa-free status. Spending a couple of weeks away occasionally doesn‚Äôt hurt if you want to do it this way.

They won't be able to do everything (e.g. the home country apostilled documents), but surely **most** of the work.

Residence status is different to tax residency. That‚Äôs more simple - 182 days in a calendar year and you‚Äôre tax resident regardless of how you became present for the 182 days. The converse - 181 days or less and you‚Äôre not tax resident regardless of residence status. (Also be aware of the 90 days rule though which applies if present over 90d over 3 out of the 4 preceding years)
